org.openimaj.content.animation.animator

Class AbstractValueAnimator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.content.animation.animator.AbstractValueAnimator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of value produced
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueAnimator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LinearByteValueAnimator, LinearDoubleValueAnimator, LinearFloatValueAnimator, LinearIntegerValueAnimator, LinearLongValueAnimator, LinearShortValueAnimator

    public abstract class AbstractValueAnimator<T>
extends Object
implements ValueAnimator<T>
    Base class for objects capable of "animating" a value; that is providing a new value everytime nextValue() is called, subject to some constraints.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractValueAnimator

        public AbstractValueAnimator(T initial,
                     int startWait,
                     int stopWait)
        Construct with initial value
        Parameters:
        initial - initial value
        startWait - amount of time in ticks to wait before starting animation.
        stopWait - amount of time in ticks to wait after finishing animation.

    • Method Detail

      • nextValue

        public T nextValue()
        Get the next value. If the animator has finished, the continuation is checked to see if there are more animators to run. If not, then the last value is returned.
        Specified by:
        nextValue in interface ValueAnimator<T>
        Returns:
        the next value.

        Has the animator finished animating the value.
        Specified by:
